refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: GtkBox is an abstract widget which encapsulates functionallity for a particular kind of container, one that organizes a variable number of widgets into a rectangular area. GtkBox currently has two derived classes, GtkHBox and GtkVBox.

The rectangular area of a GtkBox is organized into either a single row or a single column of child widgets depending upon whether the box is of type GtkHBox or GtkVBox, respectively. Thus, all children of a GtkBox are allocated one dimension in common, which is the height of a row, or the width of a column.

GtkBox uses a notion of packing. Packing refers to adding widgets with reference to a particular position in a GtkContainer. For a GtkBox, there are two reference positions: the start and the end of the box. For a GtkVBox, the start is defined as the top of the box and the end is defined as the bottom. For a GtkHBox the start is defined as the left side and the end is defined as the right side.

Use repeated calls to gtk_box_pack_start() to pack widgets into a GtkBox from start to end. Use gtk_box_pack_end() to add widgets from end to start. You may intersperse these calls and add widgets from both ends of the same GtkBox.
Use gtk_box_pack_start_defaults() or gtk_box_pack_end_defaults() to pack widgets into a GtkBox if you do not need to specify the expand, fill, or padding attributes of the child to be added.

Because GtkBox is a GtkContainer, you may also use gtk_container_add() to insert widgets into the box, and they will be packed as if with gtk_box_pack_start_defaults(). Use gtk_container_remove() to remove widgets from the GtkBox.
Use gtk_box_set_homogeneous() to specify whether or not all children of the GtkBox are forced to get the same amount of space.
Use gtk_box_set_spacing() to determine how much space will be minimally placed between all children in the GtkBox.
Use gtk_box_reorder_child() to move a GtkBox child to a different place in the box.
Use gtk_box_set_child_packing() to reset the expand, fill, and padding attributes of any GtkBox child. Use gtk_box_query_child_packing() to query these fields.

refsect2.title: GtkBox
refsect2.para:
The GtkBox describes an instance of GtkBox and contains the following fields. (These fields should be considered read-only. They should never be set by an application.)
GList * children; a list of children belonging the GtkBox. The data is a list of structures of type GtkBoxChild.
gint16 spacing; the number of pixels to put between children of the GtkBox, zero by default. Use gtk_box_set_spacing() to set this field.
guint homogeneous; a flag that if TRUE forces all children to get equal space in the GtkBox; FALSE by default. Use gtk_box_set_homogeneous() to set this field.

refsect2.title: GtkBoxChild
refsect2.para: The GtkBoxChild holds a child widget of GtkBox and describes how the child is to be packed into the GtkBox. Use gtk_box_query_child_packing() and gtk_box_set_child_packing() to query and reset the padding, expand, fill, and pack fields.

GtkBoxChild contains the following fields. (These fields should be considered read-only. They should never be directly set by an application.)
GtkWidget * widget; the child widget, packed into the GtkBox.
guint16 padding; the number of extra pixels to put between this child and its neighbors, set when packed, zero by default.
guint expand; flag indicates whether extra space should be given to this child. Any extra space given to the parent GtkBox is divided up among all children with this attribute set to TRUE; set when packed, TRUE by default.
guint fill; flag indicates whether any extra space given to this child due to its expand attribute being set is actually allocated to the child, rather than being used as padding around the widget; set when packed, TRUE by default.
guint pack; one of GtkPackType indicating whether the child is packed with reference to the start (top/left) or end (bottom/right) of the GtkBox.

refsect2.title: gtk_box_pack_start ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_box_pack_start (GtkBox *box, GtkWidget *child, gboolean expand, gboolean fill, guint padding);
refsect2.para: Adds child to box, packed with reference to the start of box. The child is packed after any other child packed with reference to the start of box.

listitem.simpara: a GtkBox.
the GtkWidget to be added to box.
TRUE if the new child is to be given extra space allocated to box. The extra space will be divided evenly between all children of box that use this option.

TRUE if space given to child by the expand option is actually allocated to child, rather than just padding it. This parameter has no effect if expand is set to FALSE. A child is always allocated the full height of a GtkHBox and the full width of a GtkVBox. This option affects the other dimension.

extra space in pixels to put between this child and its neighbors, over and above the global amount specified by spacing in GtkBox. If child is a widget at one of the reference ends of box, then padding pixels are also put between child and the reference edge of box.

refsect2.title: gtk_box_pack_end ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_box_pack_end (GtkBox *box, GtkWidget *child, gboolean expand, gboolean fill, guint padding);
refsect2.para: Adds child to box, packed with reference to the end of box. The child is packed after (away from end of) any other child packed with reference to the end of box.

listitem.simpara: a GtkBox.
the GtkWidget to be added to box.
TRUE if the new child is to be given extra space allocated to box. The extra space will be divided evenly between all children of box that use this option.

TRUE if space given to child by the expand option is actually allocated to child, rather than just padding it. This parameter has no effect if expand is set to FALSE. A child is always allocated the full height of a GtkHBox and the full width of a GtkVBox. This option affects the other dimension.

extra space in pixels to put between this child and its neighbors, over and above the global amount specified by spacing in GtkBox. If child is a widget at one of the reference ends of box, then padding pixels are also put between child and the reference edge of box.

refsect2.title: gtk_box_pack_start_defaults ()
refsect2.para: Adds widget to box, packed with reference to the start of box. The child is packed after any other child packed with reference to the start of box.
Parameters for how to pack the child widget, expand, fill, and padding in GtkBoxChild, are given their default values, TRUE, TRUE, and 0, respectively.

listitem.simpara: a GtkBox.
the GtkWidget to be added to box.

refsect2.title: gtk_box_pack_end_defaults ()
refsect2.para: Adds widget to box, packed with reference to the end of box. The child is packed after (away from end of) any other child packed with reference to the end of box.
Parameters for how to pack the child widget, expand, fill, and padding in GtkBoxChild, are given their default values, TRUE, TRUE, and 0, respectively.

listitem.simpara: a GtkBox.
the GtkWidget to be added to box.

refsect2.title: gtk_box_get_homogeneous ()
refsect2.para: Returns whether the box is homogeneous (all children are the same size). See gtk_box_set_homogeneous().

listitem.simpara: a GtkBox
TRUE if the box is homogeneous.

refsect2.title: gtk_box_set_homogeneous ()
refsect2.para: Sets the homogeneous field of GtkBox, controlling whether or not all children of box are given equal space in the box.

listitem.simpara: a GtkBox.
a boolean value, TRUE to create equal allotments, FALSE for variable allotments.

refsect2.title: gtk_box_get_spacing ()
refsect2.para: Gets the value set by gtk_box_set_spacing().

listitem.simpara: a GtkBox
spacing between children

refsect2.title: gtk_box_set_spacing ()
refsect2.para: Sets the spacing field of GtkBox, which is the number of pixels to place between children of box.

listitem.simpara: a GtkBox.
the number of pixels to put between children.

refsect2.title: gtk_box_reorder_child ()
refsect2.para: Moves child to a new position in the list of box children. The list is the children field of GtkBox, and contains both widgets packed GTK_PACK_START as well as widgets packed GTK_PACK_END, in the order that these widgets were added to box.

A widget's position in the box children list determines where the widget is packed into box. A child widget at some position in the list will be packed just after all other widgets of the same packing type that appear earlier in the list.

listitem.simpara: a GtkBox.
the GtkWidget to move.
the new position for child in the children list of GtkBox, starting from 0. If negative, indicates the end of the list.

refsect2.title: gtk_box_query_child_packing ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_box_query_child_packing (GtkBox *box, GtkWidget *child, gboolean *expand, gboolean *fill, guint *padding, GtkPackType *pack_type);
refsect2.para: Returns information about how child is packed into box.

listitem.simpara: a GtkBox.
the GtkWidget of the child to query.
the returned value of the expand field in GtkBoxChild.
the returned value of the fill field in GtkBoxChild.
the returned value of the padding field in GtkBoxChild.
the returned value of the pack field in GtkBoxChild.

refsect2.title: gtk_box_set_child_packing ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_box_set_child_packing (GtkBox *box, GtkWidget *child, gboolean expand, gboolean fill, guint padding, GtkPackType pack_type);
refsect2.para: Sets the way child is packed into box.

listitem.simpara: a GtkBox.
the GtkWidget of the child to set.
the new value of the expand field in GtkBoxChild.
the new value of the fill field in GtkBoxChild.
the new value of the padding field in GtkBoxChild.
the new value of the pack field in GtkBoxChild.

refsect2.title: The :homogeneous property
refsect2.para: Whether the children should all be the same size.
Default value: FALSE

refsect2.title: The :spacing property
refsect2.para: The amount of space between children.
Allowed values: >= 0
Default value: 0

refsect2.title: The :expand child property
refsect2.para: Whether the child should receive extra space when the parent grows.
Default value: TRUE

refsect2.title: The :fill child property
refsect2.para: Whether extra space given to the child should be allocated to the child or used as padding.
Default value: TRUE

refsect2.title: The :pack-type child property
refsect2.para: A GtkPackType indicating whether the child is packed with reference to the start or end of the parent.
Default value: GTK_PACK_START

refsect2.title: The :padding child property
refsect2.para: Extra space to put between the child and its neighbors, in pixels.
Allowed values: <= G_MAXINT
Default value: 0

refsect2.title: The :position child property
refsect2.para: The index of the child in the parent.
Allowed values: >= -1
Default value: 0
